content: You are going to permanently delete the <1>{{domain}}</1> space with all the data and accounts.  A request to delete <1>{{domain}}</1> will be sent to the {{productName}} owner to the email address <1>{{email}}</1>.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a warning message before permanently deleting a setup portal. The message informs users that all data and accounts will be deleted and sends a request to the product owner via email. This appears in a dialog component for confirmation of deletion.

usage.context:
<>
 <Text className="warning-text" fontSize="16px" fontWeight={700}>
 {t("Common:Warning")}!
 </Text>
 <Trans
 i18nKey="DeleteSetupPortalText"
 values={{
 productName: t("Common:ProductName"),
 domain,
 email,
 }}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation maintains the XML-like tags (<1> </1>) which are not standard in Arabic text. These should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags surrounding '{{domain}}'.  For example, change '<1> {{domain}} </1>' to '{{domain}}'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation maintains the XML-like tags (<1> </1>) which are not standard in Arabic text. These should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags surrounding '{{email}}'. For example, change '<1> {{email}} </1>' to '{{email}}'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "domen adının silinməsi üçün sorğu" is not the most natural translation of "A request to delete". A better phrasing would convey that a request *for* deletion will be sent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Siz bütün məlumatların və hesabların yerləşdiyi <1>{{domain}}</1> domenini həmişəlik siləcəksiniz. <1>{{domain}}</1> domeninin silinməsi üçün sorğu {{productName}} sahibinə <1>{{email}}</1> e-poçt ünvanına göndəriləcək.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Czech translation lacks the leading space before the opening quote mark `<1>` as present in the English content. This could disrupt the rendering of the variable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Add a leading space before `<1>` in the Czech translation:  " Trvale odstraníte prostor <1>{{domain}}</1> se všemi daty a účty."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon in '{{productName}} :n' is incorrect and should be a space.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Olet poistamassa <1>{{domain}}</1>-tilaa  tietoineen ja tileineen pysyvästi. <1>{{domain}}</1> -tilan poistopyyntö lähetetään {{productName}} omistajalle sähköpostiosoitteeseen <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation consistently includes `<1>` tags around the `{{domain}}` variable. While the English uses these tags, it's important to confirm whether these are necessary in the Armenian context and intended to be rendered/removed by the system or if they should be omitted.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify if the `<1>` tags are required and intended to be included in the final rendered text. If not, remove them.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation uses a full stop (.) after the phrase "すべてのデータとアカウントを含む <1>{{domain}}</1> スペースを恒久的に削除します." While grammatically correct, it feels a bit abrupt. It might be more natural to soften it slightly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: すべてのデータとアカウントを含む <1>{{domain}}</1> スペースを恒久的に削除します。念のため、確認をお願いいたします。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation maintains the <1> tags around 'domain' which are unnecessary and visually disruptive.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1>{{domain}}</1> tags around 'domain' in the Korean translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase '이메일(<1>{{email}}</1>)' sounds slightly awkward. It implies that the email address itself is being sent.  While understandable, a more natural phrasing would improve clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace '이메일(<1>{{email}}</1>)' with '이메일 주소(<1>{{email}}</1>)' or simply '이메일(<1>{{email}}</1>)' depending on desired formality and emphasis.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English term 'space' is translated as 'vietni'. While 'vietne' can mean website, in this context, 'telpa' (meaning 'space' or 'area') would be more accurate to convey the intended meaning of a dedicated area within a system.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jūs neatgriezeniski dzēsīsiet <1>{{domain}}</1> telpu ar visiem datiem un kontiem.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "U gaat... definitief verwijderen" is a bit clunky in Dutch. A more natural phrasing would be "U gaat... permanent verwijderen" or "U gaat... definitief wissen".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: U gaat de ruimte <1>{{domain}}</1> met alle gegevens en accounts permanent verwijderen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation uses "obszar roboczy" for 'space'. While technically correct, 'przestrzeń' might be more aligned with the intended meaning of 'space' in a digital context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider replacing 'obszar roboczy' with 'przestrzeń'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "{{productName}}" is not accurately translated. It should be translated depending on the product name, as it is a placeholder.  Assuming it represents a product's name, a more accurate translation would be something like 'responsável' or 'administrador' of the product.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider translating '{{productName}}' as 'responsável' or 'administrador' depending on the context. For example, 'Uma solicitação para excluir <1>{{domain}}</1> será enviada ao responsável {{productName}} para o endereço de e-mail <1>{{email}}</1>.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'You are going to permanently delete' is overly literal and sounds unnatural in Portuguese. A more natural phrasing would be 'Você apagará permanentemente' or 'Você irá excluir permanentemente'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Você apagará permanentemente o espaço <1>{{domain}}</1> com todos os dados e contas.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of '<1>{{domain}}</1>' is awkward. While it's present in the English, it's better to avoid in the translation if it doesn't add clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Você apagará permanentemente o espaço <1>{{domain}}</1> com todos os dados e contas. Uma solicitação para excluir o {{productName}} será enviada ao proprietário para o endereço de e-mail <1>{{email}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "You are going to" is awkwardly translated as "Intenţionaţi să vă". A more natural Romanian phrasing would be closer to "Veţi".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Veţi șterge definitiv spațiul <1>{{domain}}</1>...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ඔබ සියලු දත්ත සහ ගිණුම් සහිත" is slightly awkward. A more natural translation of "with all the data and accounts" would be something like "සියලු දත්ත හා ගිණුම් සහිත".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ සියලු දත්ත හා ගිණුම් සහිත

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ඉල්ලීමක්' (illēmimak) feels slightly formal and might be better translated to reflect a more natural request in Sinhala. Perhaps something like 'ඉල්ලුමක්' or 'ඉල්ලුවක්' would be preferable. It depends on the tone desired.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ <1>{{domain}}</1> මැකීමට ඉල්ලුවක් {{productName}} හිමිකරුට

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation uses the same formatting tags (<1>{{domain}}</1>) as the English. While technically correct, it's unnecessary and might confuse translators.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the unnecessary formatting tags, as they are likely used for processing and not intended in the final output.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The space after the closing angle bracket in '<1>{{domain}}</1>' is unnecessary and visually awkward.
The Serbian phrase 'e-pošte' is a bit formal. While technically correct, 'email' is more commonly used.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: e-mail

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "You are going to" is awkwardly translated as "sileceksiniz". A more natural Turkish phrasing would be something like "<1>{{domain}}</1> alanını...silmeyi planlıyorsunuz" or simply "<1>{{domain}}</1> alanını...sileceksiniz". The current phrasing makes the sentence sound overly formal and slightly unnatural.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{domain}}</1> alanını tüm veriler ve hesaplar ile birlikte kalıcı olarak sileceksiniz.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of `<1>{{domain}}</1>` is necessary for the context, but consider if a more concise way to refer to it is possible within the translation to avoid redundancy.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: While not strictly incorrect, consider options to reduce repetition where appropriate (e.g., a pronoun like 'bu alan' (this space) after the first mention if the context allows).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "及其所有数据和帐户" (and all data and accounts) is a bit clunky in Chinese. It could be more naturally expressed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 您将永久删除<1>{{domain}}</1> 空间，包括所有数据和帐户。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of `<1>{{domain}}</1>` is present in both English and Chinese, but slightly jarring. While technically correct based on the original, consider if it can be improved for readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider if the repetition of `<1>{{domain}}</1>` is strictly necessary and if the sentence flow could be improved without it.
